definition: to sprout/to bud/to have a strong affection for (slang)/adorable (loanword from Japanese 萌え moe, slang describing affection for a cute character)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: With a strong desire on the bud.
sentences.chinese: 就萌動着一種強烈渴望。

sentences.english: Then the youth buds the day, the rainy night starts to become the sad reason.
sentences.chinese: 而後青春萌動的日子，雨夜開始成爲憂傷的理由。

sentences.english: Beginning of spring and summer, brilliant.
In the rootstock sprout to leaf grafting as well.
sentences.chinese: 在砧木萌動到展葉期嫁接爲好。

sentences.english: Chunguang everywhere are beautiful, the Qingming vegetation Germinating scene.
sentences.chinese: 到處是春光明媚，草木萌動的清明景象。

sentences.english: The temperature of flower bud sprouting is 0℃.
sentences.chinese: 花芽萌動的生物學零度爲0℃。

sentences.english: Deep palace adytum, do not block girl desire for love to stir.
sentences.chinese: 深宮內院，擋不住少女春心萌動。
某些東西在我內心萌動。

sentences.english: The desire to write was stirring in Martin once more.
sentences.chinese: 創作的慾望又在馬丁心裏萌動。

sentences.english: General adult germinating in the spring of each year to carry out a Pruning ago.
sentences.chinese: 一般成株於每年春季萌動前進行一次修剪。

definition: the whole year must be planned for in the spring (idiom)/early planning is the key to success
pinyin: yi1 nian2 zhi1 ji4 zai4 yu2 chun1

definition: timing (of a signal or sequence)/time course
to grow (usually of abstract things)/to yield/to develop
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
lit. the duck is the first to know if the spring water is warm (idiom)/fig. an expert in the field knows which way the wind blows
pinyin: chun1 jiang1 shui3 nuan3 ya1 xian1 zhi1
